bullets: Increased realized profits by $1.8 million per month for blending operations by leading the development of a quantitative finance tool using Python and C++.
Utilized Python for rapid prototyping, data analysis, and algorithm development by leveraging Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy while referencing a Fortran-based codebase.
Converted to C++ for a durable, high-performance solution, enhancing computational efficiency in real-time data processing and complex financial modeling.

Integrated ZeroMQ ensuring high fault-tolerance asynchronous data flow, FastFlow for reducing computationally expensive tasks through parallelization, and Eigen for optimized linear algebra operations.
Developed a simple dashboard allowing traders to access financial reports using React and Tailwind.
Reduced plant monitoring costs by up to 36% by building an energy analytics web application with sensor integrations providing key metrics to the Operations Team using React, Express, and AWS.
Developed a dynamic and responsive UI enabling complex state management and interactive real-time charts using Redux, Plotly, and Tailwind.
Integrated real-time data streams using Express and SocketIO to automatically send updates. Processed sensor data using Node-RED and connected with AWS S3 and AWS SQS for downstream consumption.
Improved bug-fix turnaround time by writing automated test scripts and detailed bug reports with replication steps.
